p: Structural Spike (S) proteins drive the entry of the CoVs SARS-CoV and SARS-CoV-2 into target host cells by engaging the cellular receptor ACE2. Analogous to SAR-CoV infection, interaction of the S protein of SARS-CoV-2 with cellular ACE2 facilitates the attachment of the virus to target cells [11]. This step is also functionally associated with the activation of cellular TMPRSS2, a type-II transmembrane serine protease that drives the entry of virus into the target cell and is regulated by androgens ( Fig. 2 ). SARS-CoV infection is dependent on the proteolytic activity of TMPRSS2 and results in cleavage of SARS S protein at multiple sites [12]. Proteolytic cleavage of SARS S protein by TMPRSS2, known as S priming, mediates efficient virus-host cell fusion and decreases virus sensitivity to neutralizing antibodies [13].
